You might not need Industry jargon

You certainly can support IE 9 and below without jQuery, but we don't. Please stop messing with us.

Industry jargon, and its cousins are great, and by all means use them if want to sound like a douche.

If you're working in the tech industry, on the other hand, please take a moment to consider if you actually need to use Industry jargon. Maybe you can include a few choice words, and forgo the requirement. If you're only targeting more modern language speakers, you might not need anything more than plain old English.

At the very least, make sure you know what Industry jargon is doing for you, and what it's not. Some people believe that Industry jargon is making us smarter when, in truth, it makes you sound like a complete douche.

Talking

Taking this offline

Industry Jargon


  Taking this offline

Standard English


  Let's talk about this later

Alternative 1


  I have no clue what you're talking about. I need to go
  online and look it up. We'll talk again once I've figure it out.

Bubble Up

  Bubble up

Standard English


  Bring up

Alternative 1


  Talk about

Alternative 2


  Escalate
